meanings.definition: A person who believes that knowledge and reality are based on individual perception and interpretation.
meanings.sent1: As a subjectivist, she always trusts her own feelings and thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The subjectivist argued that everyone's truth is unique to them.
meanings.sent3: The subjectivist walked into a wall because they believed it wasn't really there.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a subjectivist's canvas, painting reality with personal colors.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivist's world was a kaleidoscope of ever-changing perspectives.

meanings.definition: Relating to the theory that knowledge and reality are based on individual perception and interpretation.
meanings.sent1: The subjectivist approach to art values personal expression above all.
meanings.sent2: Her subjectivist views colored her understanding of the world.
meanings.sent3: The subjectivist interpretation of the movie turned it into a comedy.
meanings.sent4: His subjectivist lens transformed the mundane into the extraordinary.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivist philosophy invites a rainbow of diverse opinions.
